doc.previous: India is also planning to buy UAVs two troops (eight drones each) of IAI Heron from Israel.Under the Rs 1,200 crore contract with Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI), the Army will begin inducting these new Heron drones from January 2014.[80] Also, India is developing UAVs that are capable of flying on solar power.[81] Developed by DRDO (Defence Research and Development Organisation, New Delhi and Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, Bangalore)
after: Some of the drones were developed by Pakistan Govt and Private Companies
Burraq UCAV (combat drone) developed by Pakistan
